meanings.definition: An ornamental border of threads left loose or formed into tassels or twists.
meanings.sent1: The curtains had delicate fringes that swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She sewed golden fringes onto the edge of the pillow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the fringes of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the fringes of a colorful tapestry, adding joy to the room.
meanings.sent5: The fringes on the scarf danced in the sunlight, creating a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: The outer, marginal, or extreme part of an area, group, or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The house was located on the fringes of the city, away from the bustling center.
meanings.sent2: They explored the fringes of the forest, where the trees were sparse.
meanings.sent3: The fringes of the conversation touched on sensitive topics, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: His ideas often came from the fringes of society, bringing fresh perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The fringes of the desert seemed endless, stretching out into the horizon.
